metadata.feature_description: Multi-language support for workflow names, states, and notification messages.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify workflow UI displays with localized resources

steps.action: Login as superuser and navigate to Settings > Workflow
steps.expected: Workflow page loads with all UI elements displaying localized text from Workflow.resx
steps.actual: Workflow page loaded successfully with all localized UI elements: 'Workflows' title, description text, 'Create New Workflow' button, table headers (WORKFLOW TYPE, IN USE, ACTIONS, DEFAULT), 'Workflow States' section, 'Workflow Name', 'Description' labels, 'Cancel' and 'Save' buttons

steps.action: Verify localized text matches resource file entries
steps.expected: UI text should match entries in Workflow.resx file
steps.actual: All UI elements match the localization resource file: settings_title.Text='Workflows', workflows_page_description.Text matches description, workflows_new_btn.Text='Create New Workflow', workflows_header_workflow_type.Text='WORKFLOW TYPE', workflows_header_in_use.Text='IN USE', workflows_header_actions.Text='ACTIONS', workflows_common_title_lbl.Text='Workflow Name', workflows_common_description_lbl.Text='Description', workflows_common_cancel_btn.Text='Cancel', workflows_common_save_btn.Text='Save'

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify localization fallback behavior for unsupported language

steps.action: Navigate to Spanish site (es-es) and access Settings > Workflow
steps.expected: Workflow page should load, falling back to default English resources since no Spanish translation exists
steps.actual: Workflow page loaded on Spanish site with English text displayed correctly. The DNN Localization Framework correctly falls back to the default Workflow.resx file when no Workflow.es-ES.resx translation file exists

observations: The Workflow.resx file contains comprehensive localization entries for all workflow UI elements including: navigation labels, button texts, validation messages, form labels, table headers, workflow state labels, notification settings, and error messages
No Spanish translation file (Workflow.es-ES.resx) exists in the codebase - only the default English resource file is present
The localization infrastructure is properly implemented and working - when accessed from the Spanish site, the UI correctly falls back to the default English resources
State names like 'Draft', 'Published', 'Ready For Review' are stored as workflow data rather than localized resources - these would need database-level localization support for multi-language display
